conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to force voice reminders even if users do not want them, while User Story B wants ALFRED to activate automatically to support health without user request. The conflict is on the system behavior about voice activation: one forces reminders regardless of user consent, and the other expects automatic activation to support users proactively. These are opposite expectations on voice activation control.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to force smart voice reminders even if users do not want them, so users follow important instructions.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to activate automatically anytime to support my health without me needing to ask.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants all meetings to be online without exceptions, while User Story B requires inviting caregivers to virtual exercise sessions, implying some meetings can be non-online or flexible. This creates opposite expectations about holding only online meetings.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to hold all meetings online without exceptions, so I can explain updates and keep control.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to invite my caregiver to virtual exercise sessions so we can share challenges and keep me motivated.
